meanings.definition: A fictitious prose narrative of book length, typically representing character and action with some degree of realism.
meanings.sent1: I read a novel about a brave knight on a quest.
meanings.sent2: She borrowed a novel from the library to read over the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The novel she wrote was so funny, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like a novel, full of unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The novel painted a vivid picture of life in a small village.

meanings.definition: Different from anything seen or known before; new or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The new student had a novel way of solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: Her novel idea for the project impressed the entire team.
meanings.sent3: It was a novel experience to taste the exotic fruit.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in novel shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The novel design of the building caught everyone's attention.
